product_name: Charlotte TilburyCharlotte's Magic Hydration Revival Cleanser
summary: SummaryCharlotte's Magic Hydration Revival Cleanser deeply cleanses, gently removes makeup, and instantly hydrates without stripping or drying.

weeks: Skin looks glowing + radiant in 7 days and pores appear reduced by 4x in 14 days**Tested on 33 peopleKey IngredientsHydrating Hyaluronic Acid: Powerful hydration for smoother, plumper looking lossItem 2621968How To UseAs a cleanser:Apply a small amount to the palm of the hand.Add a couple of drops of water then gently rub hands together.Apply evenly across the face and massage into how_to_use: As a cleanser:Apply a small amount to the palm of the hand.Add a couple of drops of water then gently rub hands together.Apply evenly across the face and massage into skin.Use AM + PM to deeply cleanse, purify and melt away all makeup + impurities.For best results, use Charlotte's Magic Cream or Magic Water Cream after Charlotte's Magic Hydration Revival Cleanser for immediate skin revival and the perfect base for makeup.

reviews.headline: I would not buy this product again
reviews.comments: I absolutely love all of Charlotte Tilbury face care products, except this cleanser. It is very harsh my skin started burning as soon as I started rubbing it in my cheeks. It almost felt like I had small cuts on my skin or something. I left it for about another minute to see if the burning subsided, but it only got worse. I will admit it deeply, deeply cleans your face and strips it of any oils as well which I didn't like. My face was left tight as a drum, red as a beet and the next day I broke out (mind you I never have acne) I had pimples all on my cheeks. All in all it was way too harsh for my skin.

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: I can't explain but I don't like it.

reviews.headline: I'm Conflicted
reviews.comments:
Okay, so, I do think it is much more hydrating than any other cleanser I've tried. I love the texture/consistency; it's super creamy. The smell is a little weird - it kind of reminds me of old-school Olay or something. But my main gripe is that it BURNS!!! It burns like a chemical peel! For face wash?? WHY?!?! That part is so off-putting, because I just don't understand why or how a hydrating cleanser burns like an acid??

TL;DR: It works, but weirdly stings.

reviews.headline: Love this product
reviews.comments: Totally recommended, after using it your skin feels soft, clean, fresh and with less noticeable pores.

faceoff_positive.comments: Ooooh this stuff is exactly what a toy is to a kid, for an adult! Luxury in a bottle! The smoothest, cleanest, perfectly enhanced cleanser! Now that my excitement is out of the bag, I'd like to just rave on how wonderful this cream to foam to milk cleanser is! It goes on nice and thin as the cream part, you massage it into your skin and watch it magically turn to a foamy kind of wash, continue massaging and then it becomes a kind of thick milky texture. As the consistency's change, you can feel how each layer does something different. It's like, at first you are prepping for a clean.. and then it goes to actually cleaning, and finishes with a moisturizing and hydrating touch. At the end, your skin is plumped up, glowing, and oh so smooth! It even smells clean.. with maybe a faint hint of roses. It has no problems removing all the makeup and pollution, and left my skin feeling and looking way better than it did at the start! Some additional pros for using this includes how it makes your pores look reduced, and leaves a glow in its place. The longer you use this product, the better your skin looks and feels! You use this in the AM and the PM, you just apply and rinse with warm water. That's it, that's all for the most beautiful skin you could possibly have! Definitely give this a try and prepare to be amazed!
faceoff_positive.headline: The best cleanser!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I received this product for free from Influenster and Charlotte Tilbury in exchange for my honest review. 

I've luckily been able to try out a few of Charlotte Tilbury's products (all makeup) and have loved them all! This was the first time I tried a skincare item so had very high expectations. 

The pros:
• It comes with a safety seal, which is super important to me with skincare. 
• It has a pleasant scent (but those who dislike scented skincare, may not like this cleanser). 
• It removed all of my makeup (I was not wearing eye makeup so am unable to comment on how well it does removing eye makeup). 
• I like that it goes from cream to foam to milk. 

BUT, I have to get to the cons. The con's definitely outweigh the pros and I won't be using this again. 

As soon as I put it on my dry skin (before even adding the warm water to make it foamy), my skin started burning! But only in certain areas, it was very, very odd. And then as soon as I removed it, a large red bump appeared on my face. I have never had this happen with a cleanser before, and I have tried a LOT!! It also left my skin feeling super dry and stripped afterwards. 

Unfortunately, I will not be using this again. Everyone's skin is different! Mine is fairly sensitive, but I have never had a reaction like this before. Super bummed BUT this does not change my opinion on Charlotte Tilbury's products. There might just be an ingredient in this specific cleanser that doesn't agree with my skin.
faceoff_negative.headline: I really wanted to love this!!
